thread.title: Ilocos Sur marijuana grower slips from authorities
thread.title_full: Ilocos Sur marijuana grower slips from authorities

title: Ilocos Sur marijuana grower slips from authorities
text:
Nation ( Leaderboard Top ), pagematch: 1, sectionmatch: 1 Ilocos Sur marijuana grower slips from authorities By Artemio Dumlao (philstar.com) | Updated March 10, 2017 - 4:55pm Policemen uprooted fully-grown marijuana plants in Mt. Chumanchil. Philstar.com/Artemio Dumlao, File photo 
VIGAN CITY, Philippines - A marijuana (cannabis) grower slipped from authorities Thursday after his plantation was raided Wednesday in hinterland Nagbukel, Ilocos Sur. 
George Cabalar alias Tomas, was able to flee and evade raiding anti-narcotics agents of the Philippine Drug Enforcement Agency (PDEA) and Ilocos Sur policemen, though his 600 fully-grown marijuana plants worth P120,000.00 were torched. 
The cannabis grower reportedly noticed the raiding authorities approaching his marijuana plantation and managed to flee on foot. 
Aside from the marijuana plants, authorities seized another 20 kilos of dried marijuana valued at P500,000 from Cabalarâ€™s plantation. 
Authorities are suing Cabalar for illegal drugs and will pursue him until he is brought to the jail, the PDEA-Ilocos region said. Nation ( Article MRec ), pagematch: 1, sectionmatch: 1
